content:
Fundamentally Thunderbird is a mail client, it lives on your local machine and has only the storage you have free on your local machine, in the case of IMAP limited to the storage allowed by the relevant mail provider.

As you appear to think Thunderbird is a mail provider like Gmail, Yahoo or GMX then it will not meet your needs anyway. I am not even going to try and assist you with your configuration issues as you are, as you say, "not interested" in having a mail client.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Welk hostingbedrijf gaat het om? Is er geprobeerd om iets te versturen met de combinatie poort 587 met STARTTLS? Probeer het instellen anders eens andersom, eerst SSL/TLS selecteren en dan 465 selecteren en wijzigen naar 587.
creator: Fjoerfoks

content:
Dankjewel voor je reactie Fjoerfoks. Savii is mijn Host. Heb hen gemaild maar nog geen antwoord binnen.

creator: rian7jo

content: Deze hostingprovider staat (nog) niet in de lijst die bekend is bij Thunderbird op https://autoconfig.thunderbird.net/v1.1/. Dit betekent in dit geval dat je de configuratie zelf handmatig moet doen volgens de handleiding op https://support.savvii.nl/nl/support/solutions/articles/101000520280-hoe-stel-ik-premium-e-mail-in-op-thunderbird-. In die handleiding geven ze zelf aan dat het poort 587 met STARTTLS moet zijn. De automatische instelling van Thunderbird klopt dus. Probeer dus met deze instellingen en kijk welke foutmelding je krijgt bij het verzenden van een e-mailbericht, of al bij het instellen van de configuratie. Wellicht is de combinatie gebruikersnaam en wachtwoord niet correct.

creator: davidsk

content: Are you sure you are running 115.10.1? 115.10.0 is known to have that problem (won't restart because it never shutdown all processes cleanly).
creator: gd_smth

content: To be more exact, TB 115.10.0 has a bug where restart may not occur due to leaving those processes you see still running after shutdown. However, this is thought to only happen if the server setting "Empty Trash on Exit" is configured for IMAP servers. TB 115.10.1 is supposed to fix the problem. Re: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1891889
creator: gd_smth

content:
For me, 115.10.1 did fix the problem. I use the Empty Trash on Exit option for an IMAP server.

Yesterday (and before) I was seeing the problem of the processes not shutting down and preventing Thunderbird from restarting. My systems updated Thunderbird this morning to 115.10.1 and the problem has been resolved on both systems here.

creator: davidsk

content: Do they appear after Help > Troubleshoot mode? If not, does repair folder help, from right+click on folder > properties?
creator: wsmwk

content: I had a problem with missing emails with version 115.10.1. Thunderbird updates automatically, so I'm not sure when that occurred. My missing emails were all "read" emails and if I read a new email, it would disappeared when I closed it after reading it. Is that what's going on with you, too? If so, we figured out how to make the "read" emails reappear: Right above the message pane, is the search box for that mailbox and to the right of the search box are five icons. These are toggle switches. The first icon is "Show only unread messages". If only your unread messages have disappeared and you click on that icon, I think your missing messages will reappear. I'd never noticed those five icons before. I thought we must have inadvertently clicked the icon, but If you're having the same problem, I think TB v 115.10.1 must be responsible.
creator: nonpsvdl

content: Do the dummy accounts have unique login addresses online? Or are they aliases of the main account? What are incoming server settings for the dummy accounts and the main account? Knowing that may help. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
I shouldn't have referred to them as dummy accounts; they are all independent login addresses, not aliases. They are all collected together with separate inboxes etc. in Thunderbird. I meant dummy only in the sense that they are used when I don't want to disclose my personal addy, or when I want to collect conversations in a separate place.

The server settings, if I understand what you mean by that, are identical for each account. One possible wrinkle is that, for some reason, my ISP routes all e-mail through Yahoo before collecting them and sending them to me. That has also been the case for many years. The tech-rep from my ISP was aware of that and found no issues with that connection.
creator: curl-dive

content:
Good suggestion. I can only log into my mail accounts at Yahoo 1 at a time, but when I do, they are all showing themselves to operate exactly as I want/expect. That is, there are no duplicate messages in any of my inboxes. However, it is odd that my main inbox only shows the one most recent message, and thinks it is unread, even though there are several items held there in my corresponding Thunderbird inbox, and the most recent e-mail has been marked read. It seems that at some point, Yahoo stops keeping track of past e-mails, but it takes a couple of days.

The account I am using for this exchange is the one that was not receiving duplicates. It shows both of the alerts to your 2 posts in here, just as it should. Those alerts are not being duplicated anywhere.

Can you refer me to the thread where someone was having a similar problem? Perhaps my answer lies there.
